page.title: 15The use of Bayford Station
page.content: {One person}is employed at Bayford Station; he works a split shift, 4 hours in the morning and 4 hours in the evening to cover the rush hours. Repair work on the line is done on Sundays so as to cause minimal inconvenience, as not many people use the railway on Sundays. Bayford Station is not used a great deal; during the rush hours about{100 {commuters}use the station, and about 30 during non-peak hours. In the car park at Bayford and on the road outside about 40 cars are parked daily. A{bus service}No. 308 from Hertford runs by the station but only on{2 days {of the week. Train passes and tickets are used in about the same amount, showing there are a lot of regular train users at Bayford Station.
